answers.answer: awww I am sorry I think everyone is away for Christmas, but I am in and out on another forum I do , how are you feeling today ,I hope you have it sorted out a bit, others will be back soon and no what to suggest to you, hang in there and go to the ER if you feel really ill  PM me if you want to talk...

Hi,how are you now?  Please come back on line and let us know you are ok.I think your doctor should not have 'just given' you insulin.  THere is a steep learning curve there, and it takes some time to get levels adjusted and right, and to learn how to use insulin well.  May have been better if you'd been admitted.There is a good website with lots of support I can recommend you to, if you are interested.  We are not allowed to put in the links here, but you can google **********.  It is a diabetes forum, and they are very informative and supportive over there.  THere are also many many people who can reply to you pretty quickly.
Please go to ergent care facility if you have them or hospital, its imperative you get that sugar under control. A sugar level of 25 is URGENT. Let's us know how you are.

Thanks. Although I had a spike, at 32.5, this morning I am at 22.5, better, but still high. I am continuing to take the meds and my insulin; however, the doctor only started me off at 5 units, twice a day, which I believe is very minimal. I am going to contact his office today to give them my readings and see where we go from here. Thank you for your support.

question: Very afraid. Have had horrible symptoms for a week now - sleeping for hours, dehydrated, feet killing me, dizzy, acid reflux, and vomiting. Resting sugar levels over 25.Doctor just started me on insulin to keep me out of emergency and I am still taking my metformin and diamicron, but not sure if I should be taking all. It's Xmas Eve and no one to turn to, but I am very light-headed and not sure about going to sleep. If I fall asleep I hope I wake up.
title: Taking Metformin, Diamicron and Insulin
